Pre-Game Insights: South Africa captain Aiden Markram is confident his side can end their luckless run at global events.
Sri Lanka captain Wanindu Hasaranga backs his team’s strong bowling attack to lead the way.
South Africa will have to adapt to the unknown conditions quickly in their T20 World Cup Group D opener against Sri Lanka in New York.
Sri Lanka have won all of their last three T20 series – albeit they lost three out of eight matches – against Bangladesh, Afghanistan and Zimbabwe.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The fixture will be played on a drop-in pitch, which was used for the first time when India beat Bangladesh by 60 runs in a warm-up game on Saturday.
Markram said his team “will have to assess [the conditions] really quickly and then adapt plans”.
Hasaranga said the conditions in the US “are similar to Sri Lanka” and was confident of getting a favourable result at the new venue.
South Africa go into the tournament on the back of last month’s 3-0 series loss against co-hosts West Indies but will hope the recent run of matches in the region will help them in the World Cup.
Others: The tournament’s ‘group of death’ opens with a massive clash between former champions Sri Lanka and underachievers South Africa in New York.
South Africa are ranked seventh in the ICC T20 team rankings.
Group D – or the so-called group of death – also includes Bangladesh, the Netherlands and Nepal.
South Africa have a well-known list of failures at 50-over and 20-over World Cups, where they have been favourites going in and found unusual ways to go out.
